extendedIngredients.name: bacon

title: Saucy Shrimp And Grits
summary: Saucy Shrimp And Grits might be just the Southern recipe you are searching for. Watching your figure? This gluten free recipe has 400 calories, 30g of protein, and 12g of fat per serving. For $2.89 per serving, this recipe covers 20% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. 8 people were impressed by this recipe. Not a lot of people really liked this main course. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 40 minutes. If you have coarse salt and ground pepper, coarse grits, canned tomatoes, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 55%. This score is pretty good. Similar recipes are Saucy Crawfish with Whole Corn Grits, Quick Saucy Shrimp, and Saucy Shrimp a la Diabla.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 99 dollars.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris

instructions: After grits have cooked for 15 minutes, cook bacon in a large skillet over medium until browned, 4 to 6 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer to a paper-towel-lined plate. Add onion and garlic to fat in skillet; season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until onion is tender and browned, 8 to 10 minutes.

steps.step: After grits have cooked for 15 minutes, cook bacon in a large skillet over medium until browned, 4 to 6 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer to a paper-towel-lined plate.
Add onion and garlic to fat in skillet; season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until onion is tender and browned, 8 to 10 minutes.
